page.title: 09Dairy Farms
page.content: All the farms in our area are Dairy farms.Daily routines vary but generally the farmer would start by milking his cows.Morning milking times tend to be between 6.30 to 8.45am.The farmer will milk his cows again from about 4.30 to 6.45pm.Some farmers have different milking parlours.The farmer usually milks Freisian cows.One common parlour is the Herringbone.There is also an Abreast parlour.The Milk Marketing Board collects the milk in large blue tankers and it is taken to Davidstowe where it is made into cheese.In the old days milk churns were used and many collection points can still be seen at Kestle and Underlane and can be seen at other places.Another breed of cow is the Guernsey cow and its milk goes to Ambrosia where it is made into custard and cream.
